column4: Hi everyone! I am haveing a little problem with my gnome-terminal. When it starts the working directory is in "/" (root) how to I change it to "~/" (home).
Are you logged in as root?
no i am just logged in on an account with full administration.
http://ubuntuforums.org/showpost.php?p=243332&postcount=6
How did you find that so quick?
The powers of Google =P
what did you search 'cause I have been searching all over the place!
gnome terminal start directory
typical, my searches is to advanced xD
Thanks! It works. (:
=D
Alternately you can look for headers, but that's a little more complicated =P
would you care telling more about that? (:
Well PNG images and RAR files have distinct headers
If you hex edit and find the header you'll be able to separate them
do you recommend any program for HEX editing?
Not really, anything works
Anything? Well I know that I cannot open a file with the .rar extension with   gedit
There are a lot of them, for example, ghex or something
Now I typed   "sudo apt-get install ghex" and it installed but how do I open a fire with this program?
ghex /path/to/file?
now I got into my Downloads dir in my home folder and in here i wrote "ghex skype-installer-blabla.deb" and it out puts something like "did you mean 'hex' instead of 'ghex'"...
